metadata.title: Philippine Business Connections: Athletics, Olympics & Major Corporations
metadata.description: Business ownership and political connections for sports organizations, major corporations, and media outlets in the Philippines
metadata.notes: Initial data collection complete. Additional conglomerates added (JG Summit, LT Group, Aboitiz, GT Capital). Data structures created for government contracts, campaign financing, and PBA history. Ready for data collection phase.

pba_teams.name: San Miguel Beermen
pba_teams.owner: San Miguel Corporation (San Miguel Brewery subsidiary)

political_connections.description: Cojuangco family controls San Miguel Corporation - historical ownership, verify current structure
political_connections.research_note: San Miguel Corporation ownership structure has evolved. Cojuangco family had significant historical control. Current ownership structure needs SEC filing verification.

political_connections.description: Cojuangco-Aquino marriage connections

pba_teams.notes: Most successful PBA team. San Miguel Corporation is one of Philippines' largest conglomerates.

pba_teams.name: Barangay Ginebra San Miguel
pba_teams.owner: San Miguel Corporation (Ginebra San Miguel, Inc. subsidiary)

political_connections.description: Same ownership as San Miguel Beermen

pba_teams.name: Magnolia Hotshots
pba_teams.owner: San Miguel Corporation (San Miguel Food and Beverage subsidiary)

political_connections.description: Same ownership as other San Miguel teams

pba_teams.notes: Also known as Magnolia Chicken Timplados Hotshots

pba_teams.name: TNT Tropang Giga
pba_teams.owner: Smart Communications (PLDT Inc. subsidiary, MVP Group)

political_connections.description: MVP Group has infrastructure contracts and business-political relationships. PLDT is major telecommunications provider with government relationships.
political_connections.research_note: MVP Group controls PLDT, Meralco, Metro Pacific. No direct political dynasty but significant infrastructure contracts require government relationships.

pba_teams.notes: MVP Group (Manny V. Pangilinan) - no direct political dynasty but significant business-political networks. PLDT is major telecommunications provider.

political_connections.description: Meralco is major utility company (electricity distribution) with government regulatory relationships. Part of MVP Group.
political_connections.research_note: Utilities require government regulation and approvals. MVP Group has significant stake in Meralco.

pba_teams.name: NLEX Road Warriors
pba_teams.owner: NLEX Corporation (Metro Pacific Tollways, MVP Group)

political_connections.description: NLEX is major tollway operator (North Luzon Expressway) with government contracts and regulatory approvals. Part of Metro Pacific Investments under MVP Group.
political_connections.research_note: Tollway operations require government contracts and regulatory approvals. MVP Group has major infrastructure investments.

pba_teams.name: Phoenix Super LPG

political_connections.description: Dennis Uy is Duterte administration ally and business partner

pba_teams.notes: Dennis Uy has business connections to Duterte administration

political_connections.description: Same owner as Phoenix - Dennis Uy

pba_teams.name: Converge FiberXers
pba_teams.owner: Converge ICT Solutions, Inc. (Dennis Anthony Uy)

political_connections.description: Telecommunications company (fiber internet provider), requires government licenses and may have government relationships
political_connections.research_note: Verify if Dennis Anthony Uy is related to Dennis Uy (Phoenix/Terrafirma). Telecommunications requires NTC licenses.

pba_teams.notes: Converge ICT is major fiber internet provider. Research Dennis Anthony Uy's background and any connections to Dennis Uy (Phoenix/Terrafirma owner).

pba_teams.name: NorthPort Batang Pier

political_connections.description: Mikee Romero - research political connections and port operations
political_connections.research_note: Port operations may require government approvals. Research Mikee Romero's background and political connections.

pba_teams.notes: Owned by Sultan 900, Inc. / GlobalPort 900, Inc. Research Mikee Romero's political connections and port business relationships.

political_connections.description: Research ownership and political connections
Research Dioceldo Sy and Ever Bilena political connections

olympic_organizations.name: Philippine Olympic Committee

political_connections.description: POC President Abraham 'Bambol' Tolentino is a serving congressman, illustrating overlap between political figures and sports administration
political_connections.research_note: Shows direct connection between political position and sports organization leadership.

political_connections.description: Receives government funding - political connections through leadership

olympic_organizations.notes: Current president is Abraham 'Bambol' Tolentino, who is also a serving congressman. Shows direct political-sports connection.

olympic_organizations.name: Samahang Basketbol ng Pilipinas

political_connections.description: Receives government funding - research political connections

olympic_organizations.notes: Research current leadership and political connections

athlete_political_connections.name: Manny Pacquiao
athlete_political_connections.notes: Most prominent example of athlete entering politics. Established Pacquiao political dynasty in Sarangani.

conglomerates.name: San Miguel Corporation
conglomerates.ownership: Cojuangco family (Tarlac branch) - historical control, verify current structure

political_connections.description: Cojuangco family had historical control of San Miguel Corporation. Current ownership structure needs SEC filing verification.
political_connections.research_note: San Miguel Corporation ownership has evolved. Cojuangco family had significant historical control. Need to verify current ownership structure through SEC filings.

political_connections.description: Cojuangco-Aquino marriage connections
Major campaign contributor - research specific campaigns
Infrastructure project contracts - research specific projects

conglomerates.notes: One of Philippines' largest and oldest conglomerates. Controls multiple PBA teams.

conglomerates.name: Ayala Corporation

political_connections.description: Historical connections to various administrations, infrastructure projects
Real estate development approvals, infrastructure projects

conglomerates.notes: No active political dynasty but significant business-political networks and influence

conglomerates.name: SM Group (Sy Family)

political_connections.description: Real estate development approvals, local government relationships
Mall developments require local government approvals

conglomerates.notes: No active political dynasty but significant business-political influence through real estate development

conglomerates.name: Metro Pacific Investments / MVP Group

political_connections.description: Major infrastructure projects (tollways, utilities, telecommunications) require government contracts and regulatory approvals
political_connections.research_note: MVP Group controls NLEX, SCTEX tollways, Meralco utility, PLDT telecommunications. All require government contracts/approvals.

political_connections.description: Business-political relationships through infrastructure and utilities. No direct political dynasty but significant government relationships required for operations.

conglomerates.notes: No direct political dynasty but significant business-political networks. Controls multiple PBA teams (TNT, Meralco, NLEX). Major infrastructure and utility provider requiring government relationships.

conglomerates.name: Villar Group

political_connections.description: Direct integration - family members in politics and business
Mark Villar was DPWH Secretary (2016-2021), now Senator
Cynthia Villar is Senator
Manny Villar was Senate President (2006-2008)

conglomerates.notes: Clear example of direct political-business integration. Family members hold both political positions and control business empire.

conglomerates.name: JG Summit Holdings

political_connections.description: Research Gokongwei family political connections
Real estate development approvals, infrastructure projects

conglomerates.notes: One of Philippines' largest conglomerates. Research Gokongwei family political connections.

conglomerates.name: LT Group (Lucio Tan Group)

political_connections.description: Research Lucio Tan political connections
Research government contracts and relationships

conglomerates.notes: Major conglomerate controlled by Lucio Tan. Research political connections and government relationships.

conglomerates.name: Aboitiz Group

political_connections.description: Research Aboitiz family political connections
Power generation contracts, infrastructure projects

conglomerates.notes: Major conglomerate with significant power generation and banking interests. Research political connections.

conglomerates.name: GT Capital Holdings

political_connections.description: Research Ty family political connections
Real estate development approvals, infrastructure projects

conglomerates.notes: Major conglomerate with banking and automotive interests. Research Ty family political connections.

media.name: ABS-CBN Corporation
media.ownership: Lopez family (Lopez Holdings Corporation 56.28%, ABS-CBN Holdings Corporation 32.21%)

political_connections.description: Lopez family (Iloilo political dynasty) owns ABS-CBN through Lopez Holdings Corporation (56.28%) and ABS-CBN Holdings Corporation (32.21%). Lopez family has longstanding history in Philippine politics and business.
political_connections.research_note: Lopez family has historical political connections. Eugenio Lopez was involved in politics. Family has been influential in both media and political spheres.

political_connections.description: Franchise renewal denied 2020, widely seen as politically motivated
Closure linked to critical coverage of Duterte administration

media.notes: Major example of how political power affects media. Franchise denial seen as political retaliation.

media.name: GMA Network
media.ownership: Gozon, Duavit, Jimenez families (GMA Holdings Inc.)

political_connections.description: Gozon and Duavit families have been influential in both media and political spheres in the Philippines. Chairman Felipe Gozon and President Gilberto Duavit Jr. are key figures.
political_connections.research_note: Gozon and Duavit families have political influence but no active political dynasty identified. Research specific political positions held by family members.

media.notes: Gozon and Duavit families have been influential in media and political spheres. Research specific political positions and connections.

political_connections.description: Same ownership as MVP Group - research media-political relationships

media.name: Philippine Star

political_connections.description: Belmonte family (Quezon City political dynasty) retains 21% stake in Philippine Star. Feliciano Belmonte Jr. served as Speaker of the House of Representatives.

political_positions.name: Feliciano Belmonte Jr.
political_positions.position: Speaker of the House of Representatives

political_connections.description: MediaQuest Holdings (MVP Group) owns majority stake (51%), creating business-political network connection

media.notes: Belmonte family has direct political dynasty connection. Feliciano Belmonte Jr. was Speaker of the House and Quezon City Mayor. MediaQuest (MVP Group) owns majority stake.

media.name: Manila Bulletin
media.ownership: Yap family (U.S. Automotive Co., Inc. 54.20%, USAUTOCO, Inc. 23.34%)

political_connections.description: Yap family has significant business interests in the Philippines through U.S. Automotive Co., Inc. and USAUTOCO, Inc. Specific political affiliations less documented.
political_connections.research_note: Yap family has business interests but specific political connections need deeper research. Business interests may require government relationships.

media.notes: Yap family owns through U.S. Automotive Co., Inc. (54.20%) and USAUTOCO, Inc. (23.34%). Research specific political connections.

media.name: Philippine Daily Inquirer

political_connections.description: Rufino-Prieto family owns through Pinnacle Printers Corporation (68.9%), the holding investment arm. Family has been involved in various business ventures, with some members participating in civic activities.
political_connections.research_note: Rufino-Prieto family has business interests. Research specific political positions and connections. Civic activities may indicate political relationships.

media.notes: Rufino-Prieto family owns through Pinnacle Printers Corporation (68.9%). Research specific political connections and civic activities.

media.name: Rappler

political_connections.description: Investigative journalism, government conflicts, legal cases
Multiple legal cases, seen as political harassment

media.notes: Not a political dynasty connection, but shows how media faces political pressure for critical coverage
